publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1052 Brian Adam: Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies—That the Parliament expresses concern that the new fast-speed telecom system Wireless IP Local Loop, is not being rolled out in Scotland currently; notes that this will disadvantage the development of e-commerce in Scotland, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make the appropriate representations to allow equality of access to new technologies through all available avenues, including regulation. R
S1M-1052 Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies (lodged on 26 June 2000) Alex Neil*
S1M-1052 Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies (lodged on 26 June 2000) Shona Robison*

S1M-1052 Brian Adam: Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies—That the Parliament expresses concern that the new fast-speed telecom system Wireless IP Local Loop, is not being rolled out in Scotland currently; notes that this will disadvantage the development of e-commerce in Scotland, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make the appropriate representations to allow equality of access to new technologies through all available avenues, including regulation. R Supported by: Alex Neil, Shona Robison
S1M-1052 Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies (lodged on 26 June 2000) Christine Grahame*, Fiona McLeod*, Michael Russell*, Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1052 Brian Adam: Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies-That the Parliament expresses concern that the new fast-speed telecom system Wireless IP Local Loop, is not being rolled out in Scotland currently; notes that this will disadvantage the development of e-commerce in Scotland, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make the appropriate representations to allow equality of access to new technologies through all available avenues, including regulation. R Supported by: Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Fiona McLeod, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-1052 Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies (lodged on 26 June 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-1052 Brian Adam: Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies-That the Parliament expresses concern that the new fast-speed telecom system Wireless IP Local Loop, is not being rolled out in Scotland currently; notes that this will disadvantage the development of e-commerce in Scotland, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make the appropriate representations to allow equality of access to new technologies through all available avenues, including regulation. R Supported by: Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Fiona McLeod, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Nora Radcliffe, Fergus Ewing, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram
S1M-1052 Access to WIPLL and other New Technologies (lodged on 26 June 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

R Supported by: Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Fiona McLeod, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Nora Radcliffe, Fergus Ewing, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenneth Gibson
